hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Pairs Reversion on 5-Day Z-Score Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 5-day rolling z-score of the BTC/ETH price ratio exceeds ±2.0 standard deviations from its 90-day mean, the ratio will revert to its mean within 10 trading days with 70% probability when trading in NEUTRAL or BULL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH maintain strong long-term correlation (0.7-0.9) but experience temporary divergences during news events or sector rotation. In non-stress regimes, these divergences tend to revert as arbitrage capital enters. The 90-day mean captures medium-term equilibrium while 5-day z-score identifies acute dislocations.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH price ratio 5-day z-score > +2.0 (short BTC, long ETH)
BTC/ETH price ratio 5-day z-score < -2.0 (long BTC, short ETH)
Market regime is NEUTRAL or BULL (regime confidence > 55%)
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Mean reversion success rate < 60% in backtest across 2021-2024 cycles, or stop-loss hit rate > 35%.
